Money in software development is in:

  • Good requirements
  • Good implementations

The choice of the programming language is close to irrelevant to fulfill a requirement with the good implementation, i.e., algorithm. A particular language, most importantly, the runtime and its included libraries the code will, eventually, run in, might help one get there faster or in a "nicer" way. One might have preferences over syntax, paradigma, etc., but all has little impact on end value. There is, virtually, nothing only one language "does" or one laguage "doesn't".

Having that in mind, here goes an exploration of basics, similarities and differences of some of the most used languages. Simple to complex examples implemented parallelly on each language to outline its implementation of the intended funcitonalilty. It might also serve as a quick cheatsheet.

All source code can be found this GitHub Repository.
